law.catch_line: A pre-existing authority may be governed by articles of organization if:...

section.section:
A pre-existing authority may be governed by articles of organization if:
the pre-existing authority meets the requirements of subsection (b) or (c) of this section;
the custodian of records files with the Secretary of State the documents required under subsection (d) of this section; and
the Secretary of State issues a certificate of approval in accordance with subsection (e) of this section.
Articles of organization shall comply with § 12-205(b) through (d) of this subtitle.

text.section:
Before a pre-existing authority may adopt articles of organization under this subsection, the articles of organization must be:
recommended in writing by the chief elected official;
approved by an extraordinary majority of the board of commissioners of the authority; and
adopted by an extraordinary majority of the legislative body.

Before a pre-existing authority may adopt articles of organization under this subsection:
the custodian of records shall provide documentation to the Secretary of State that within 5 years before the date the documentation is submitted:
the political subdivision, within each of any 3 fiscal years within the 5-year period, has provided financial assistance to the authority from local tax revenues or bond sale proceeds in an amount equal to the greater of:
the product of $1 times the number of residents of the political subdivision as published annually by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene or as otherwise available; and
the product of $100 times the total number of housing units owned or managed by the authority; and
the authority, at the request and with the financial support of the political subdivision, is operating one or more housing projects for which the federal government provided no more than half of the development and operating costs; and
the articles of organization must be:
recommended in writing by the chief elected official;
approved by a resolution of the board of commissioners of the authority; and
adopted by a resolution or ordinance of the legislative body.

section.section: If the Secretary of State finds that the requirements of subsection (b) or (c) and subsection (d) of this section have been satisfied, the Secretary of State shall endorse the articles as "approved" and issue a certificate of approval attached to the endorsed articles.
When the certificate of approval is issued, the articles of organization as filed are considered to have been adopted.
